channel.title: Marshall Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Marshall Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: Oxford Lions Club Glasses Donation Drive
item.description:
The Oxford Lions Club Sight Saving Committee is collecting used eyeglasses (including sunglasses) and glasses cases to donate to children worldwide. The lenses and frames are modified to meet individual children's eye needs, with 900+ pairs sent annually. Donations can be sent to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary School or Shaunna Tafelski at the Board Office by the beginning of December. The Lions Club is happy to pick up donations if needed.

item.title: 2025-2026 Yearbook Order Form Available
item.description:
The 2025-2026 yearbook order form is now available for students and families. Order forms can be accessed to purchase the upcoming school year's yearbook.

View original newsletter

item.title: December Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The December 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. Breakfast options include items like Apple Cinnamon Texas French Toast, French Toast Sticks, Mini Powdered Donuts, Mini Cinnamon Pull Apart, Sausage Egg & Cheese Biscuit Sandwich, Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Pizza, Egg & Cheese English Muffin Sandwich, Maple Snack'n Waffle, Chocolate Donut Holes, Mini Maple Pancakes, Breakfast Burrito, Apple or Cherry Frudel, French Toast Bites, and Biscuits & Sausage Gravy. Lunch options include French Toast Sticks, Walking Taco w/Doritos, Boneless Chicken Wings, Rotini & Italian Meat Sauce, Bosco Sticks, Pizza Cruncher Bites, Mini Confetti Pancakes, Chicken Nuggets, Mini Cheese Pizza Bagels, Cheeseburger on a Bun, Apple Cinnamon Texas French Toast, Nachos w/Taco Meat & Cheese, Holiday Meal (Roast Turkey and Gravy, Mashed Potatoes), Popcorn Chicken, and Chicken Patty on Bun. 100% Fruit Juice, Assorted Fruit, and Yogurt are included with every breakfast. Choice of Milk is included with every lunch. Menus are subject to change based on product availability.

View original newsletter

item.title: Head Lice Check Before School Break
item.description:
The district nurse requests that parents check their children for head lice before returning from the upcoming school break. Lice commonly spread during breaks, gatherings, and sleepovers, so early detection and treatment is important. If lice or nits are found, please treat before returning to school. Additional information is available on the school website under Departments > School Nursing Offices. Contact: Tonja Fangman, BSN, RN, LSN at fangmant@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Tech Healthy Household Presentation Event
item.description:
Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. The event features a 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A covering tech addiction, how to discuss screen time with kids, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. The presentation is hosted by Dino Ambrosi, Founder of Project Reboot, and all attendees will receive actionable take-home resources and dinner table discussion guides. PSD approved event. More info at https://projectreboot.school

item.title: Monthly PTG Meeting - November 10th
item.description:
The monthly PTG (Parent Teacher Group) meeting is scheduled for November 10, 2025 from 6:00-7:00 PM in the Marshall Cafeteria. All parents and guardians are encouraged to attend this one-hour meeting.

item.title: November 2025 Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. Breakfast items include Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast (Nov 3, 10), Breakfast Burrito (Nov 11), Breakfast Pizza (Nov 6, 19), Biscuits & Sausage Gravy (Nov 14), and special items for National Donut Day (Nov 5). Lunch offerings feature Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll (Nov 5), National Nacho Day (Nov 6), Mac & Cheese with Garlic Toast (Nov 12), Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy (Nov 19), and various pizza options throughout the month. All breakfasts include 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit, and milk; all lunches include choice of milk. No school on November 4, 24-28 for Thanksgiving Break.

National Donut Day - Chocolate Donut Holes (Breakfast)

item.title: Marshall Free Pantry for Students
item.description:
The Marshall Free Pantry is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and is open to all students. Available items include veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, apple sauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, toothpaste, and other hygiene products. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker, at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: PTG Thanks Families for Halloween Parade Attendance
item.description:
The PTG extends gratitude to all families who attended their Halloween Parade. They hope attendees enjoyed the coffee, doughnuts, and friendship with Marshall families during the event.

View original newsletter

item.title: November Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The November 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. Breakfast includes items like Mini Chocolate Chip French Toast, Breakfast Burritos, and Pancake on a Stick, with 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit, and milk included daily. Lunch features meals such as Popcorn Chicken Dinner Roll, Mac & Cheese, and a special Holiday Meal with Roast Turkey and Gravy on November 19th. Choice of milk is included with every lunch. Both menus note no school on November 4th, 24th-25th (Thanksgiving Break), and 26th-28th.

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall Mondays School Spirit Initiative
item.description:
Marshall Mondays begin on October 20 and continue every Monday through the end of the year. Students are encouraged to show school spirit by wearing Talawanda gear, Marshall Elementary shirts, or red, white, and blue clothing. The initiative promotes school pride with the motto "GO BRAVE!"

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall Mondays and Halloween Parade Information
item.description:
Marshall Mondays begin 10/20 - students should wear Talawanda gear, Marshall Elementary shirts, or red, white, and blue every Monday through the end of the year to show school spirit. As weather gets colder, please send students with warm coats and layers for outdoor recess. The Halloween Parade is scheduled for Friday, October 31st at 9:30 a.m. - families can park in the upper lot, enjoy free doughnuts and coffee/hot chocolate for purchase, and gather in the back lot around 9:25 for the parade.

item.title: Marshall Free Pantry Available to All Students
item.description:
The Marshall Free Pantry is located at the front left side of the school near the gym doors and is open to all students. Available items include veggies, fruit, pasta, soup, apple sauce, snacks, school supplies, body wash, shampoo, toothpaste, and more. For questions, donations, or suggestions, contact Chrissy, Marshall Social Worker at 513-273-3611 or rolfesc@talawanda.org.

View original newsletter

item.title: Marshall PTG Updates and Events
item.description:
The Marshall Parent Teacher Group (PTG) supports Marshall Elementary through fundraising and community events. Current fundraisers include Fall Mum Flower Sale, Glow Dance Party Boosterthon, Spring Flower Sale, and Box Tops for Education. The PTG hosts 25-26 new family, student, and staff events throughout the 2025-2026 school year, including skate parties, staff meals, the Spring Fling Dance (April 24, 2026), Mayfest (May 15, 2026), and various conferences and appreciation events. They also support field trips, R.A.H. (Random Acts of Hospitality), general funding requests, and music receptions year-round.

Marshall Open House PTG Booth & Staff Luncheon

item.title: Pre-Halloween Parade Coffee and Donuts Gathering
item.description:
Join fellow families before the Marshall Halloween Parade on Friday, October 31st from 9:00-9:30 AM at the shelter house near the overflow parking lot at Bicentennial Commons. Free donuts will be provided by Oxford Donuts, with coffee and hot chocolate available for purchase from Rambling Roast. The group will head to the bay loop at 9:30 AM to watch the parade together. Costumes welcome! Sponsored by Marshall PTG.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Project Reboot: Tech Healthy Household Presentation
item.description:
Project Reboot presents "Keys to Building a Tech Healthy Household" on Tuesday, November 18th from 6-7:30 PM at Talawanda High School. This PSD-approved 60-minute presentation plus 30-minute Q&A will cover tech addiction (why it happens and how to overcome it), how to discuss screen time with kids without eye rolling, and practical tips for maintaining balanced relationships with technology. Hosted by Dino Ambrosi, founder of Project Reboot and digital wellness presenter who has spoken to over 20,000 students and parents. All attendees receive actionable resources and dinner table discussion guides. Grant support provided by Greater Oxford Community Foundation.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Kiwanis K-Kids Food Drive for Local Families
item.description:
The Kiwanis K-Kids are organizing a food drive from Monday, October 20th through Friday, October 31st to help feed local families. Needed items include instant mashed potatoes (any flavor), stuffing mix, gravy pouches, soup (cream of mushroom, cream of chicken), and canned vegetables (beans, corn, mixed vegetables). The class that donates the most items will win a pizza party.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Touch-A-Truck Event Thanks Community Partners
item.description:
Marshall Elementary's Touch-A-Truck event was a huge success, giving students hands-on opportunities to explore fire trucks, police cruisers, construction equipment, and service vehicles while meeting the people who operate them. The event featured vehicles from over a dozen community partners including Butler County Sheriff's Department, fire departments, Rumpke, Sterwerf Trucking, Peterman Bus Company, and many others. Students enjoyed climbing into vehicles, learning about machinery, and connecting with community helpers in an exciting day of learning and exploration.

View original newsletter

item.title: FCCLA Trunk or Treat Event
item.description:
FCCLA is sponsoring Trunk or Treat at Talawanda High School on Tuesday, October 28th from 6:00-7:30 PM. The event is co-sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA and is ISD approved for distribution. If you or your organization would like to participate by handing out treats from a "trunk spot," scan the QR code or use the sign-up link provided.

TRUNK or TREAT Sign Up

item.title: October Breakfast and Lunch Menus
item.description:
The October 2025 breakfast and lunch menus for Marshall Elementary are now available. Breakfast options include items like Mini Maple Pancakes, Breakfast Burritos, French Toast Bites, and various bagel sandwiches. 100% fruit juice, assorted fruit selection, and milk are included with every breakfast. Lunch offerings feature entrees such as Chicken Tenders, Tony's Deep Dish Pizza, Mini Corn Dogs, Taco Bites, and Chicken Nuggets, with choice of milk included with every lunch. A Fall Break is scheduled for October 17, 2025, with no school that day. Special days include National Apple Day on October 21 and Halloween on October 31. Menu is subject to change based on product availability.
